cookies.title: Cookies
cookies.description: A cookie is a small piece of data that’s stored on your computer, tablet, or phone when you visit a website. Most websites need cookies to work properly.

usedInService.title: How cookies are used in this service
usedInService.use1: measure how you use the service so it can be improved
usedInService.use2: remember the notifications you’ve seen so that you’re not shown them again
usedInService.use3: temporarily store the answers you give

howAreTheyUsed.title: Cookies used to measure website usage
howAreTheyUsed.description: We use Google Analytics software to collect information about how you use this service. We do this to help make sure the service is meeting the needs of its users and to help us make improvements, for example improving site search.
howAreTheyUsed.info2: how long you spend on each page
howAreTheyUsed.info3: how you got to the service
howAreTheyUsed.info4: what you click on while you’re visiting the service
howAreTheyUsed.googleShare: We allow Google to use or share this data. Find out more about how they use this information in the

optOut.access: if you do not want Google to have access to your information.

howAreTheyUsed.googleCookies: Google Analytics sets the following cookies:

cookieTable.item1Purpose: This helps us count how many people visit the service by tracking if you’ve visited before

introMessage.title: Cookies used to turn our introductory message off
introMessage.description: You may see a welcome message when you first visit the service. We’ll store a cookie so that your computer knows not to show this message again.

cookieTable.item1Purpose: Saves a message to let us know that you’ve seen our cookie message

sessionCookie.title: Cookies used to store the answers you’ve given during your visit (known as a ‘session’)
sessionCookie.description: Session cookies are stored on your computer as you browse a website, and let the website know what you’ve seen and done so far. These are temporary cookies and are automatically deleted after you leave the website.

cookieTable.item2Purpose: To know which internal IP a request should be routed to.

cookies.title: Cookies
cookies.description: Cookies are files saved on your phone, tablet or computer when you visit a website. Most websites need cookies to work properly.

usedInService.use2: measure how you use the service so it can be improved

howAreTheyUsed.title: How cookies are used in this service

googleCookies.title: To measure website use
googleCookies.description: We use Google Analytics software to collect information about how you use this service. We do this to help make sure the service is meeting the needs of its users and to help us make improvements. We do not allow Google to use or share the data about how you use this site.

optOut.title: Allow cookies that measure website use?
optOut.optOut1: Use cookies that measure my website use
optOut.optOut2: Do not use cookies that measure my website use

cookieTable.title: Cookie details
cookieTable.item1Purpose: This helps us count how many people visit the service by tracking if you’ve visited before
cookieTable.item3Purpose: Manages the rate at which page view requests are made

performance.title: To measure application performance
performance.description: We use Dynatrace Software Intelligence Platform to provide an Application Performance Monitoring Service to collect information about how you use HMCTS services. We do this to monitor HMCTS services in order to resolve issues within our services as well as collect data on how our services can be improved. HMCTS store information about:
performance.info2: Information is presented within the Application Performance Monitoring service for the purposes detailed above. We do not use or share the information for any other purpose. We do not allow Dynatrace to use or share the information for any other purposes.

optOut.title: Allow cookies that measure website application performance monitoring?
optOut.optOut1: Use cookies that measure website application performance monitoring
optOut.optOut2: Do not use cookies that measure website application performance monitoring

cookieTable.title: Cookie details
cookieTable.item1Purpose: Tracks a visit across multiple requests
cookieTable.item2Purpose: Measures server latency for performance monitoring
cookieTable.item3Purpose: Required to identify proper endpoints for beacon transmission; includes session ID for correlation

essentialCookies.title: Essential cookies
essentialCookies.description: These essential cookies do things like making the service more secure. They always need to be on.
essentialCookies.link: Find out more about essential cookies (opens in new tab)
